description.narrative:
Reviewing legal framework on digital security in Cambodia Overview of the digital context, the digital rights allow people to access, create, and publish information through online media and massive connection to an outside world. Internet usage and smart phone adoption in Cambodia has boomed in the past five years and continue to increase for years to come. Cambodia’s internet penetration rate was 52.6 percent, and the number of internet users increased by 14 percent in comparison to the previous year. Telecommunications companies have attributed the increase in penetration rate to the heightened use of social media, with the number of Facebook users in Cambodia rising from 8.8 million in 2019 to 9.2 million in 2020. The law is therefore adapting tothis new era with the development of digital rights and digital citizenship. In practice, the partnership approach between civil society and the government during the pandemic remains unclear. The commitment to intake the inputs and request from civil society regarding digital rights and digital citizenship are far beyond the expectation. Oxfam in Cambodia will be partnering with the Cooperation Committee for Cambodia (CCC) who is the main CSOs/NGOs Umbrella to carry out this project.
Objectives - To promote the understanding on digital rights and internet freedom - To protect security, privacy and expressive freedom online through better engagement on draft of Cybercrime Law process.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project#s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
